intro: Hieracium elucens, commonly known as the shining hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with ray florets, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Hieracium elucens is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
